summary: This document is an email chain from January 2022 among law enforcement and prosecutors discussing the planned guilty plea of an individual named Harris. It includes updates on notifying victims, scheduling the plea hearing, and congratulations on the Maxwell convictions.

persons.name: M. Lee
persons.context: Appears as a prosecutor in the Eastern District of New York, sending updates about Harris's plea and congratulating colleagues on the Maxwell convictions.

persons.name: Harris
persons.context: An individual whose attorney has indicated he wants to plead guilty; a plea hearing is scheduled.

connections.description: M. Lee, as an AUSA, is providing updates on Harris's planned guilty plea and coordinating victim notification.

events.title: Harris Plea Hearing
events.description: A guilty plea hearing for Harris was scheduled and reportedly went through, with sentencing set for June 10, 2022.

events.title: Plea Hearing Scheduling
events.description: The plea hearing for Harris was scheduled for January 7, 2022, at 10:30 AM by video, with efforts to notify victims.

events.title: Scheduled Sentencing for Harris
events.description: Sentencing for Harris is scheduled for June 10, 2022, at 10:00 AM, though the email suggests it may not happen.

keyFacts: An individual named Harris planned to plead guilty in early January 2022, with a hearing scheduled for January 7.
Law enforcement officials were coordinating to notify victims about Harris's plea hearing.
The email chain includes congratulations on convictions in the Maxwell case, linking this communication to the broader Epstein/Maxwell investigation context.
Access issues at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) were noted as a potential obstacle to the plea proceeding.
Multiple law enforcement and prosecution personnel from the FBI, NYPD, and U.S. Attorney's Office are involved in the correspondence, though many names are redacted.
